question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Evgenii A Sviazov's employer before 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Evgenii A Sviazov

Evgenii A Sviazov is a researcher who has made significant contributions to the field of medicine. One of the notable institutions he has been affiliated with is the Tomsk National Research Medical Center, a leading healthcare organization in Tomsk, Russia. Career

Evgenii A Sviazov's research career has been marked by his association with the Tomsk National Research Medical Center. According to his profile on ResearchGate, a social networking site for scientists and researchers, Sviazov has listed the Tomsk National Research Medical Center as one of his affiliations. [1] This suggests that he has worked at the institution, contributing to its research endeavors. Furthermore, a publication in the Journal of Pharmaceutical Sciences, co-authored by Sviazov, lists him as an affiliate of the Tomsk National Research Medical Center. [2] This provides additional evidence of his association with the institution. In addition, Sviazov's profile on the Russian Science Citation Index, a database of Russian scientists and their publications, also lists the Tomsk National Research Medical Center as one of his affiliations. [3] This further substantiates his connection to the institution. References

[1] ResearchGate. (n.d.). Evgenii A Sviazov. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/profile\/Evgenii_Sviazov>

[2] Sviazov, E. A., et al. (2019). Development and Characterization of Liposomal Formulations of Anticancer Drugs. Journal of Pharmaceutical Sciences, 108(10), 3421-3430. doi: 10.1016\/j.xphs.2019.04.023

[3] Russian Science Citation Index. (n.d.).
content.source_2: January 11, 2041, was a typical summer morning in Lismore, Australia. The sun was shining bright, casting a warm glow over the campus of Southern Cross University. In the School of Health and Human Science, the hum of activity was palpable as students and faculty alike prepared for another day of learning and discovery. Among them was Detlev Conrad Mielczarek, a renowned researcher with a passion for advancing human knowledge. As he sipped his coffee and checked his comms device, he couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and accomplishment. It was a new year, a new decade, and a new era of possibilities. Detlev had been with the School of Health and Human Science for several years, and in that time, he had made significant contributions to the field of health research. His work on personalized medicine and genomics had garnered international attention, and he was frequently invited to speak at conferences and symposia around the world. As he made his way to his laboratory, Detlev's mind was already racing with the possibilities of the day ahead. He had a meeting with his research team to discuss their latest project, a cutting-edge study on the application of artificial intelligence in healthcare. The potential breakthroughs were vast, and Detlev was determined to push the boundaries of what was thought possible. As he entered the lab, he was greeted by the familiar sight of his team huddled around a holographic display, pouring over data and discussing their findings. Detlev smiled, feeling a sense of camaraderie and shared purpose. This was what it meant to be part of a community of scholars, working together to create a better future. The meeting was productive, with the team making significant progress on their project. As the day drew to a close, Detlev felt a sense of satisfaction wash over him. It was days like this that reminded him why he loved his job – the thrill of discovery, the pursuit of knowledge, and the potential to make a real difference in people's lives. As he packed up his things and headed home, Detlev couldn't help but wonder what the future held. Would they make the breakthroughs they were hoping for? Would their research change the world? Only time would tell, but one thing was certain – Detlev Conrad Mielczarek and the School of Health and Human Science were at the forefront of the revolution, pushing the boundaries of what was possible and shaping the course of human history.
